Description: Ostracon on rim sherd of East Greek (Milesian?) pottery krater (?); outside, horizontal simple guilloche in red paint between two white stripes; inside, painted Greek inscription, added in the Hellenistic period.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Description after Prins de Jong. For the shape and decoration, compare Walter-Karydi, Samos VI, pl. 79.673.

There are substantial problems with this piece, which has not been located. See A. Johnston, 'Notes on Naukratis in the Netherland', ZPE 198 (2016) 110. For the text see Dunbabin, T. and Page, D. 1951, An Inscribed Sherd from Naukratis, BABesch 24–6, 52–3.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 5, N 15, pl. 1, N 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.026)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 46 no. I.E.8, pl. I.8)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2925 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
